trans-unit.source: One-vs-All Multiclass
trans-unit.target: One-vs-All Multiclass

trans-unit.source: Creates a multiclass classification model from an ensemble of binary classification models
trans-unit.target: Creates a multiclass classification model from an ensemble of binary classification models

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> module to create a classification model that predicts multiple classes.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> module to create a classification model that predicts multiple classes.

trans-unit.source: To use this classifier, you connect it to an existing untrained two-class classification algorithm, and configure that model.
trans-unit.target: To use this classifier, you connect it to an existing untrained two-class classification algorithm, and configure that model.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model as usual by using <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> with a labeled training dataset.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model as usual by using <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> with a labeled training dataset.

trans-unit.source: Although the training dataset might have multiple class values, the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> creates multiple binary classification models, optimizes the algorithm for each class, and then merges the models.
trans-unit.target: Although the training dataset might have multiple class values, the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> creates multiple binary classification models, optimizes the algorithm for each class, and then merges the models.

trans-unit.source: Understanding the One-vs-All Classifier
trans-unit.target: Understanding the One-vs-All Classifier

trans-unit.source: This module is useful for creating models that predict three or more possible outcomes, when the outcome depends on continuous or categorical predictor variables.
trans-unit.target: This module is useful for creating models that predict three or more possible outcomes, when the outcome depends on continuous or categorical predictor variables.

trans-unit.source: This method also lets you use binary classification methods for issues that require multiple output classes.
trans-unit.target: This method also lets you use binary classification methods for issues that require multiple output classes.

trans-unit.source: There are many ways to classify an outcome variable that has multiple values.
trans-unit.target: There are many ways to classify an outcome variable that has multiple values.

trans-unit.source: This module implements the <newTerm>one vs. all method</newTerm>, in which a binary model is created for each of the multiple output classes.
trans-unit.target: This module implements the <newTerm>one vs. all method</newTerm>, in which a binary model is created for each of the multiple output classes.

trans-unit.source: Each of these binary models for the individual classes is assessed against its complement (all other classes in the model) as though it were a binary classification issue.
trans-unit.target: Each of these binary models for the individual classes is assessed against its complement (all other classes in the model) as though it were a binary classification issue.

trans-unit.source: In essence, an ensemble of individual models is created and the results are then merged, to create a single model that predicts all classes.
trans-unit.target: In essence, an ensemble of individual models is created and the results are then merged, to create a single model that predicts all classes.

trans-unit.source: For example, let’s say you configure a <link xlink:href="12d8479b-74b4-4e67-b8de-d32867380e20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-Class SVM</link> model and provide that as input to the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> module.
trans-unit.target: For example, let’s say you configure a <link xlink:href="12d8479b-74b4-4e67-b8de-d32867380e20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-Class SVM</link> model and provide that as input to the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> module.

trans-unit.source: The module would create binary SVM models for all members of the output class and use the one-vs-all method to combine the results for all classes.
trans-unit.target: The module would create binary SVM models for all members of the output class and use the one-vs-all method to combine the results for all classes.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure the One-vs-All Classifier
trans-unit.target: How to Configure the One-vs-All Classifier

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Add one of the two-class classification models to the experiment, and configure that model.
trans-unit.target: Add one of the two-class classification models to the experiment, and configure that model.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might use a <link xlink:href="12d8479b-74b4-4e67-b8de-d32867380e20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-Class SVM</link> or <link xlink:href="e3c522f8-53d9-4829-8ea4-5c6a6b75330c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-Class Decision</link> tree model.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might use a <link xlink:href="12d8479b-74b4-4e67-b8de-d32867380e20" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-Class SVM</link> or <link xlink:href="e3c522f8-53d9-4829-8ea4-5c6a6b75330c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-Class Decision</link> tree model.

trans-unit.source: Need help choosing the right algorithm?
trans-unit.target: Need help choosing the right algorithm?

trans-unit.source: See these resources:
trans-unit.target: See these resources:

trans-unit.source: Machine learning algorithm cheat sheet for Azure ML
trans-unit.target: Machine learning algorithm cheat sheet for Azure ML

trans-unit.source: How to choose Azure Machine Learning algorithms for clustering, classification, or regression
trans-unit.target: How to choose Azure Machine Learning algorithms for clustering, classification, or regression

trans-unit.source: Note that the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> classifier has no configurable parameters of its own.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> classifier has no configurable parameters of its own.

trans-unit.source: Any customizations must be done in the model that is provided as input.
trans-unit.target: Any customizations must be done in the model that is provided as input.

trans-unit.source: Connect the untrained classifier that is the output of <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: Connect the untrained classifier that is the output of <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: On the other input of <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, connect a labeled training data set that has multiple class values.
trans-unit.target: On the other input of <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, connect a labeled training data set that has multiple class values.

trans-unit.source: After it has been trained, the model can be used to make multiclass predictions.
trans-unit.target: After it has been trained, the model can be used to make multiclass predictions.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can pass the untrained classifier can also be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled validation data set.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can pass the untrained classifier can also be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled validation data set.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> with a <link xlink:href="5a7d5466-9928-40c8-a19c-d5de4882c77e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">two class decision forest</link> model.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>One-Vs-All Multiclass</ui> with a <link xlink:href="5a7d5466-9928-40c8-a19c-d5de4882c77e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">two class decision forest</link> model.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Compare Multiclass Classifier sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525730</linkUri></externalLink>, binary classifiers are used for each digit and the results combined.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Compare Multiclass Classifier sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525730</linkUri></externalLink>, binary classifiers are used for each digit and the results combined.
